question.content: Radio broadcasting started in India in by the Radio Club of Bombay (Mumbai).

solution.content: Broadcasting 1923. Company The Indian (IBC) was formed as a private company to operate radio stations in India in 1927. The Indian State Broadcasting Service was established by the government of India in 1930. The service was renamed All India Radio (AIR) in 1936.

question.content: Which of the following novels is written by RK Narayan and also adapted into a Hindi film by the same name?

solution.content: The Guide (1965). Movies based on R.K Narayan's Novels: Banker Margayya (1983), Mr Sampath (1972).

question.content: Who was the music director of the famous film 'Sholay' released in 1975?

solution.content: RD Burman. Sholay Movie: Director (Ramesh Sippy), Producer (GP Sippy), Writer (Salim-Javed).

question.content: Who among the following singers had a Guinness World Record for recording 28 songs in a single day? (As of December 2022.)

solution.content: Kumar Sanu: Awards and Honours Maharashtra Ratna Awards (2014), Padma Shri (2009). Udit Narayan (Playback singer): Awards Padma Shri (2009), Ð adma Bhushan (2016). Sonu Nigam: Awards Padma Shri (2022). Arijit Singh - Singer and music composer.

question.content: The Telugu movie RRR created history by winning a Golden Globe for the Natu Natu song composed by whom among the following personalities?

solution.content: MM Keeravani. RRR film: Director S. S. Rajamouli. Academy Awards (Oscars Awards) were first awarded in 1929.

question.content: Azhar (2016), a sports-related movie, is based on which of the following sports?

solution.content: Cricket. Azhar (2016) The story inspired by Mohammad Azharuddin (Former national cricket team captain). Movies based on Indian Cricketers: Sachin Tendulkar: A Billion Dreams (2017)- Based on Former Indian Cricketer Sachin Tendulkar. 83 (2021) - Based on the India national cricket teain which won the 1983 led by Kapil Dev, Cricket World Cup. M S Dhoni: The Untold Story (2016) Mahendra Singh Dhoni (Former captain of the Indian national cricket team).

question.content: Which of the following is NOT an example of Mass Media?

solution.content: Door to door campaign. Mass Media: A technology that is intended to reach a mass audience. It is the primary means of communication used to reach the general public.

question.content: Who among the following composers won the Grammy in 2015 for his album 'Winds of Samsara'a collaboration with South African flautist Wouter Kellerman?

solution.content: Ricky Kej. He won his second Grammy award in 2022 for his album 'Divine Tides' in category of Best New age album.

question.content: Who among the following was the winner of the National Film Award in 2002 for his choreography in the Hindi movie 'Lagaan'?

solution.content: Raju Khan. Lagaan: {Director: Ashutosh Gowariker, Actor: Aamir Khan, music director: A. R. Rahman}. Terence Lewis won the 2002 American Choreography Award for his work in this movie.

question.content: Who among the following became the first Asian to win the award for best sound for the documentary 'India's Daughter' at the coveted Motion Picture Sound Editors' 63rd annual Golden Reel Awards?

solution.content: Resul Pookutty (Indian film sound designer, sound editor, and audio mixer). Awards: Golden Reel Award (2016), Padma Shri (2010), National Film Award for Best Audiography (2010), Asianet Film Awards (2009).

question.content: 'The Unblemished One', a dance film by has won two awards at White Unicorn International Film Festival (WUIFF) in the categories of 'Experimental Film' and 'Film on Women.

solution.content: Anjana Ghonasgi (Bharatnatyam). She has coined her own style called "Mudratutting".

question.content: In 2012, for which of the following films did Pandit Birju Maharaj win the 'Best Choreography' category National Award?

solution.content: Vishwaroopam (for Unnai Kaanaatha song). Filmfare Award for Best Choreography for Mohe Rang Do Laal, Bajirao Mastani (2016).

question.content: Who among the following has sung the famous Bollywood song 'Channa Mereya'?

solution.content: Arijit Singh. The song "Channa Mereya" is from "Ae Dil Hai Mushkil" (Indian film directed by Karan Johar in 2016).

question.content: Who was India's first Olympian who went on to star in Hollywood and Broadway?

solution.content: Norman Pritchard (Norman Trevor), was a British-Indian athlete and actor who became the first Asian-born athlete to win an Olympic medal when he won two silver medals in athletics at the 1900 Paris Summer Olympics representing India.
